clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of a Multi-Mineral Fluoride Mouthrinse
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of a Multi-Mineral Fluoride Mouthrinse

collaborator.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goals of this project are to determine the anticaries benefits of a prototype multi-mineral mouthrinse containing 225 ppm fluoride and 30 ppm of a Ca through the remineralization of enamel white-spots (non-cavitated lesions). The selection of patients with pre-existing white-spot lesions will permit an opportunity to evaluate the efficacy of the multi-mineral mouthrinse in reminerzalizing and/or inhibiting progression of enamel white-spot lesions.

arm_group.description: ADA-accepted over-the-counter 226 ppm fluoride mouthrinse (i.e. ACT, 226 ppm fluoride mouthrinse distributed by Chattem, Inc.)

intervention.description: Over-the-counter level of fluoride (226 ppm) in a fluoride mouthrinse; FDA considers fluoride in a rinse formulation as a 'drug'; dosage is 10 mL per treatment.
Over-the-counter level of fluoride (226 ppm) plus calcium (30 ppm) in a fluoride mouthrinse; FDA considers fluoride in a rinse formulation as a 'drug'; dosage is 10 mL per treatment.
